pull.title: rpc, refactor: Avoid duplicate set lookup in gettxoutproof

events.body:
@MarcoFalke you mean to change from
```
bitcoin-cli -regtest gettxoutproof '[]'
error code: -5
error message:
Transaction not yet in block
````
to
```
bitcoin-cli -regtest gettxoutproof '[]'
error code: -8
error message:
Parameter 'txids' cannot be empty
```
I've taken your test and my test suggestion and added them to #19922 (another pull reworking the test a bit)

rename.to: rpc, refactor: Avoid duplicate set lookup in gettxoutproof

events.body: Not sure if this refactor is worth it. Unless you fix the error string for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19847#issuecomment-687028015 I don't think this code needs to be touched.

events.message: rpc, refactor: Avoid duplicate set lookup in gettxoutproof
rpc: Reject empty txids in gettxoutproof

events.body:
nice small optimization!
code review ACK 52fc39917fc52c2ff279fe434431e18900b347bd

comments.body: you can move this to after the for loop and run the check on setTxids, then remove oneTxid and replace it with setTxids.front()
ATM `oneTxid` is the first `txid` in the array, with you suggestion that wouldn't be the case since `set::set` orders, right?
Right, all must be in same block.

in commit 73dc19a330f8cb063af46e6c4246f2e64a04bdc1:

Just for future reference, this is reading uninitialized memory

std::set::begin will return the end interator if the set is empty.

Dereferencing the end pointer is accessing uninitialized memory.
the bug only exists in commit 73dc19a , which can't be modified because it is already merged

Thanks for spotting @MarcoFalke.
I guess this needs for a follow up PR.
The bug is fixed in the 2nd commit 52fc39917fc52c2ff279fe434431e18900b347bd. It should have been the 1st commit.
Now I got it. An intermediate commit had this uninitialized memory access. No need for action.
